books.title: Short Plays
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A collection of sixteen short plays by George Bernard Shaw.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Anne of Green Gables
books.author: L. M. Montgomery
books.summary: A coming-of-age story of a young girl growing up on a farm on Prince Edward Island.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: Simon
books.author: J. Storer Clouston
books.summary: A small town is plunged into confused gossip when the esteemed client of a Scottish lawyer is murdered.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Mystery at Lynden Sands
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: A Chief Constable’s holiday on the coast is interrupted when he is drawn into investigating a murder.

books.title: The Story of Utopias
books.author: Lewis Mumford
books.summary: An American historian reviews the literature surrounding utopias and how they relate to contemporary society.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: Cane
books.author: Jean Toomer
books.summary: An experimental and highly lyrical novel exploring the African-American experience.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Star Hunter
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: On the unexplored jungle world of Jumala the sole survivor of a spaceship crash is heir to a fortune, or has been made to believe so.

books.title: Fables
books.author: Aesop
books.summary: Aesop’s classic Fables of behavior and consequence.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
